name: pavement
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
B1 UK (US sidewalk) a path with a hard surface on one or both sides of a road, that people walk on: Keep to the pavement, Rosie, there's a good girl.
Carlos Ángel Vázquez Tena/EyeEm/GettyImages
B2 US the surface of a road when it has been covered with concrete or tarmac
More examplesFewer examplesPenalty for dogs fouling the pavement - £50.The car was parked awkwardly across the pavement.He was lying face downwards on the pavement.I've told you many a time not to ride your bike on the pavement.Jackie fell over and scraped her knee on the pavement.
